name: Gluten-Free Nubby Apple Cake
description: The other day I stumbled upon my mother's collection of old recipes. I sat for a long time looking at recipe after recipe scribbled on thin pieces of paper or, in fancier cases, stiff recipe cards. One seasonal recipe grabbed my attention: Nabby Apple Cake. Nabby? Oh! I bet the writer meant nubby. The idea of a cake studded with apple pieces sounded good to me. And if my mom kept the recipe, it must be worth making.
recipeIngredient: 4 ounces (1 cup) white or brown rice flour
4 ounces (1/2 cup; 1 stick) butter (for dairy-free, use shortening)
6 cups peeled, cored, sliced tart apples (about six apples)

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F;. Spray a 9x13-inch baking pan with non-stick cooking spray. In small bowl, whisk together white rice flour, sweet rice flour, cornstarch, baking powder, baking soda, salt, ground cinnamon, and ground nutmeg.

In stand mixer fitted with paddle attachment, cream butter and sugar together until thick paste forms, about 45 seconds. Add eggs, one at a time, and vanilla. Mix until fluffy, about one minute. Stop mixer. Scrape down sides and bottom of bowl.

Add whisked dry ingredients. Turn mixer to medium-low. Beat until a thick batter forms. Turn off mixer. Add apples. Turn mixer on to medium-low, mix until apples are coated in batter, about 30 seconds. Some apples will break up during mixing. This is fine!
Spread batter evenly into prepared pan. Bake until set, dark golden brown and aromatic, about 35 minutes. Remove from oven and place pan on wire rack to cool. Serve warm or cool.
